page.title: 13Wychnor Hall and Park
page.content: The only large historic building of interest is Wychnor Hall. This was built in the reign of William & Mary and some of the stone from an earlier hall was used in the construction. The fireplace was transferred from the old hall. The building materials are local stone and oak. Wychnor Hall has been owned by the McNeilly family for the last 5 years and was bought primarily for the beautiful view over the Trent and Swarbourne rivers. The grounds comprise 44 acres, 15 of which are the hall gardens, the remainder being leased to a local farmer, Roger Mercer. The hall is described as a working farm house rather than a grand mansion and has 12 bedrooms. The main problems associated with owning such a property are the dry rot in the cellar and the costs of the oil fired heating.
